description:
**Title:** Software Engineering Intern Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking several interns to work with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Cloud, DevSecOps, and Autonomous Systems techniques. **Must be a U.S. Citizen Internship dates: June 1st - August 20th, 2021** For each of the projects, interns will leverage the AWS machine learning tools, continue to advance KBR's knowledge and application of data analytics.

Interns will collaborate with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects such as the development of a Cloud Security Strategy to leverage the built-in capabilities provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). AWS tools used will include CloudWatch, Inspector, Systems Manager, GuardDuty, Kibana, and QuickSight, with opportunities for the addition of custom tools for configuration management, training, and other elements to complete a robust Cloud-based security framework for KBR. The framework will include an end-to-end DevSecOps platform designed to automate security requirements by embedding security controls and processes early in the DevOps workflow, and will help our customers continue to develop and apply new technology capabilities while retaining systems security.

Additional projects will include investigating the value of Digital Twin (DT) in autonomous systems use cases; investigate setting up for the use cases and how the operational AI systems would interact with DT requirements. Explore methodology to address operational decision making utilizing machine learning in Air Traffic Management and other domains. Analyze textual information in transportation datasets to identify commonalities; demonstrate Natural Language Processing (NLP) capability.

Managing telematics data, implement ability to overlay multiple vehicle routes on a map to assess road utilization. Other projects will be similar to last year's summer internship program which consisted of: Reinforcement learning technique to enable autonomous systems and robotics. Research Explainable AI and leveraging this technology to detect bias in machine learning models.

Use distributed ledger/block-chain technology to enable governance and management of flight identifiers. Edge computing utilizing neuromorphic processing. Research and development of Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) software and hardware tools; develop an AR/VR solution to simulate real-world environments and facilitate activities such as remote maintenance of complex systems and virtual training environments.

Interns will spend the majority of their time researching, installing, and configuring new tools, programming using the selected tools, and learning more efficient methods to solve a given problem. Interns are not required to be programming experts, but they should have a passion for learning new things and not be afraid to jump in and try out new tools and/or solutions. Interns will leverage an Agile Development process with daily scrum meetings facilitated using Jira to capture user stories and track the status of all issues.

Fridays are reserved for documenting the work each week in the form of a Wiki site, as well as numerous forms of documentation (PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.). Once a month, interns will present the work they have completed to other staff members at KBR, with a final presentation at the end of the summer to both KBR and customer personnel. **Required Education:** + Must be enrolled in undergraduate coursework in a related degree program at an accredited university + Must be a Rising Junior or Senior **Preferred:** + Basic familiarity with virtual environments and cloud-based technologies, as well as programming languages such as Java, Python, Perl etc.

Work Schedule: Estimated at 32-40 hours/week with flexibility to accommodate intern's education Work Location: Telework **Scheduled Weekly Hours:** 40 KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. KBR is a global provider of differentiated professional services and solutions across the asset and program life cycle within the government services and technology sectors.

KBR employs approximately 28,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in 40 countries. KBR is proud to work with customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long- term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. **At KBR, We Deliver.**

Title:

Software Engineering Intern

Around here, we define the future.

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking several interns to work with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Cloud, DevSecOps, and Autonomous Systems techniques.

Must be a U.S. Citizen Internship dates: June 1st - August 20th,2021

For each of the projects, interns will leverage the AWS machine learning tools, continue to advance KBR's knowledge and application of data analytics. Interns will collaborate with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects such as the development of a Cloud Security Strategy to leverage the built-in capabilities provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). AWS tools used will include CloudWatch,Inspector, Systems Manager, GuardDuty, Kibana, and QuickSight, with opportunities for the addition of custom tools for configuration management, training, and other elements to complete a robust Cloud-based security framework forKBR.The frameworkwill include an end-to-end DevSecOps platform designed to automate security requirements by embedding security controls and processes early in the DevOps workflow, and will help our customers continue to develop and apply new technology capabilities while retaining systems security.

Additional projects will include investigating the value of Digital Twin (DT) in autonomous systems use cases; investigate setting up for the use cases and how the operational AI systems would interact with DT requirements. Explore methodology to address operational decision making utilizing machine learning in Air Traffic Management and other domains. Analyze textual information in transportation datasets to identify commonalities; demonstrate Natural Language Processing (NLP) capability. Managing telematics data, implement ability to overlay multiple vehicle routes on a map to assess road utilization.

Other projects will be similar to last year's summer internship program which consisted of: Reinforcement learning technique to enableautonomous systemsand robotics. Research Explainable AI and leveraging this technology to detect bias in machine learning models. Use distributed ledger/block-chain technology to enable governance and management of flight identifiers. Edge computing utilizing neuromorphic processing. Research and development of Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) software and hardware tools; develop an AR/VR solution to simulate real-world environments and facilitate activities such as remote maintenance of complex systems and virtual training environments.

Interns will spend the majority of their time researching, installing, and configuring new tools, programming using the selected tools, and learning more efficient methods to solve a given problem. Interns are not required to be programming experts, but they should have a passion for learning new things and not be afraid to jump in and try out new tools and/or solutions.

Interns will leverage an Agile Development process with daily scrum meetings facilitated using Jira to capture user stories and track the status of all issues. Fridays are reserved for documenting the work each week in the form of a Wiki site, as well as numerous forms of documentation (PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.). Once a month, interns will present the work they have completed to other staff members atKBR, with a final presentation at the end of the summer to both KBR and customer personnel.

Required Education:

  • Must be enrolled in undergraduate coursework in a related degree program at an accredited university

  • Must be a Rising Junior or Senior

Preferred:

  • Basic familiarity with virtual environments and cloud-based technologies, as well as programming languages such as Java, Python, Perl etc.

Work Schedule: Estimated at 32-40 hours/week with flexibility to accommodate intern's education

Work Location: Telework

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Sigma is SaaS that democratizes decision making using data. We offer an application that lets users who are skilled in spreadsheet usage analyze mass amounts of data in their large data warehouse. This unlocks decision making across companies, letting people who aren't data scientists accelerate their work.

As an intern at Sigma you will learn:

  • How to build production software.
  • How large Single Page Applications are built and extended.
  • How backend scales to handle multiple customers and billions of data points while keeping the information secure.
  • How to own a project beginning to end.

We are an inclusive team of software engineers who complement each other's skills to inspire and design solutions that power the Sigma product experience. As an intern on this team, you will have the opportunity to experiment, prototype and implement user visible features that help our customers analyze and gather insights from their data. During the 12 week internship period, you will be paired with a mentor and collaborate with other team members, develop designs and implement a chosen solution, deploy and gather insights from customer metrics.

During your internship, you will

  • Partner with product managers, designers and other engineers
  • Design & deliver innovative solutions to improve the Sigma user experience by implementing new features.
  • Find innovative ways to optimize the performance of one or more components of the product.
  • Develop automated unit tests to get the relevant code coverage and work with product owners and techpubs to document your work.

We expect the following for you to be successful 

  • You must be pursuing at least a Bachelor's or a Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • Have a solid grasp of Operating Systems, Data structures, algorithms and at least one modern programming language such as Java, Python, JavaScript, etc.
  • Eager to learn and build complex user interfaces, data visualizations, or backend systems.
  • Have a drive and desire to navigate unknowns, after all that's what unlocks realizations.
  • Ability to collaborate and work in a team environment.

If you do not feel that you satisfy all the listed requirements, we encourage you to still apply. We are enthusiastically looking for people that will help us grow our company and sometimes we are imperfect communicators and can't articulate perfectly what experience is required for a role. We are looking for people that are excited to grow and constantly ask how we can do things better. If you are excited about the opportunity, we encourage you to apply even if you don't satisfy 100% of the job requirements.

Our Benefits:

  • $40/hour, 40 hours per week 
  • Flexible schedule, do the work you need to get done in the time you have to get it done
  • Opportunities to interact with Sigma leaders, build your network, and learn about the business.
  • Fun team events throughout your internship!

What's next: 

To get started, submit your application through our job posting. We review the resumes quickly that we receive but sometimes there are a lot of applications so please be sure that the relevant information on your resume stands out.

Every interview process might be a slightly different but generally you can expect the process to look like this: 

  • We expect the entire process to take no more than 2 weeks depending on your availability
  • A phone screen with someone on our hiring team
  • An "in person" interview (likely on zoom these days) with a number of people you will be working with closely to assess your technical skills as well as what you will bring to build on our culture
  • A zoom interview with the hiring manager

At Sigma, we believe every person has unique domain expertise that they bring to the table. Our mission is to give everyone the technical abilities to leverage their expertise to drive their business decisions. This idea is fundamental to who we are and how we collaborate and treat each other. We believe we are Smarter Together and what each person brings to the table helps make us (and our company) stronger.  How we do this internally is through transparency and Fearless Communication. We explain, we speak up, and we all have the opportunity to contribute to the company. With that communication, we Assume Best Intent and know what how we approach each other and our customers is with a common goal. We are Curious & Constructive in looking at how we can make our product, company, and community better. With all of these Company Values, we Aim for Greatness, we have big goals that we keep hitting and we continue to reassess how we can set those goals even higher. Come join us to help us be smarter and grow together!

We are committed to building a smart and strong team regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We look forward to learning how your experience can enable all of us to grow.

About the Position

What are you looking for in a Summer Internship?

Do you want to make a difference in society and learn new skills at the same time?  Do you want to be a valued member of a team and more than an employee number? Do you enjoy innovating and participating in hackathons?

For over 30 years, United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS) has managed the nation's organ transplant system.  We manage the "Wait List" for those who are waiting to receive a life-saving organ (or, as we call it, the "gift of life").  We create and implement the nation's transplant policies and ensure patient safety standards are met.  We educate the nation's transplant healthcare providers and support patients and their families.  Our 350+ person team is located in Richmond, Virginia and about one-third of our employees work in IT. 

We are offering two (2) 12-week Summer Internship positions for Summer 2021 supporting our IT Departments.  All students will be assigned a mentor, have structured orientation, and be placed directly on one of our software engineering teams.

        Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship is not available for this position

        Students will work 36-40 hours a week and will receive fair compensation

IT Software Engineer (2 positions)

We have eight agile teams (Team Kraken, Iron Fish, Iron Dragon, Team Carna, etc.) with various levels of software engineers (Associate to Senior) and automation testers on each team.  Interns will work with their assigned team to perform technical analysis, software design, and software testing with high quality deliverables that may go into final product releases. Students will participate in writing technical documentation as necessary by the UNOS Development Methodology and Standards, incorporate innovative ideas and approaches to software development.

Students will learn to:

        Write API, application, and database code based on business requirements or user stories, architectural requirements, and established coding standards.

        Participate in peer code reviews.

        Validate code against business and architectural requirements.

        Perform API and application system testing.

        Participate in reviews of business epics and stories.

        Troubleshoot applications and resolve defects.

        Communicate ideas in both technical and user friendly language.

        Update and maintain product documentation.

        Escalate issues and impediments in a timely manner.

        Work within established frameworks and processes.

Qualified students for this opportunity should have:

        An understanding of software design and development principles gained from course work or experience with coding in object oriented programming language.

        Possess knowledge of team-oriented and collaborative working environments.

Minimum Requirements for all listed internships

Entry level IT, software development, information security, or other related experience.

Education

This position requires the individual to be working towards a degree in Computer Science or related field of study.

Physical Requirements

General office demands

About Us

The United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS) coordinates the nation's organ transplant system, providing vital services to meet the needs of men, women and children awaiting lifesaving organ transplants. Based in Richmond, Va., UNOS is a private, nonprofit membership organization.
UNOS members encompass every transplant hospital, tissue matching laboratory and organ procurement organization in the United States, as well as voluntary health and professional societies, ethicists, transplant patients and organ donor advocates.

Summary:

The Software Engineering internship is offered to students in order to educate them on Electrical Manufacturing (RF) Engineering related activities and provide the opportunity for visiting the plant, observing other Engineers performing their work, and looking at how issues are identified and addressed in the manufacturing processes.

Join the CAES San Diego team and gain valuable experience while helping protect U.S. and allied forces around the world.

CAES has hired a number of interns upon their graduation. Our team of engineers are excellent mentors, work with interns to maximize the benefits students can achieve from working in a real manufacturing environment.


  • Will be writing software for controls and configuration of equipment - developing test software for FPGA project.

  • Add features and functionality to utilities and applications for a production environment.
  • Create automated scripts that optimize or enhance production testing.

  • Must be a US Citizen due to Government Contracts

  • Communication skills: ability to receive messages by telephone, in person, electronically and in writing; ask questions and rephrase statements to clarify meaning; ability to read, interpret and comprehend complex written technical publications; communicate quality, integrity and respect in a way that inspires others and encourages innovation and possibilities
  • Computer skills: working in networked environment using a Windows and or Windows like interface using PowerPoint, Excel, and Word software programs at an advance level; LabView, AutoCAD, SolidWorks, or exposure to 2D and 3D CAD programming a plus

  • Time Management and Organization skills: flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and assignments; ability to maintain confidentiality; work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information

Our purpose is to serve the nation with the single most trusted and capable health information network, built to increase patient safety,lower costs and ensure quality care.

What You're Like

You have a relentless desire to get stuff done. A true champion of the collective objective, you're energized by applying your expertise with a group of talented people to achieve something important, together. You're curious and passionate about new technologies and cutting-edge innovation, and you enjoy pulling together complex pieces of a puzzle to deliver a powerful and meaningful end-product. You're a translator between people and teams that don't use the same lingo. You don't settle for short-term gratification-you're into long-haul, incremental efforts that require endurance, patience and next-level collaboration.


What We're Like


Surescripts Network Technology and Operations (NT&O) is comprised of smart people who love to work towards a common goal, often delivering an innovative, industry-leading solution to the healthcare marketplace. We pride ourselves on quality work that's grounded in complete transparency and accountability. When a project goes off the rails-and they do from time to time-we rally around each other to fix it and move on. While our gratification is often the result of a months-long effort, we never tire of delivering a huge result that has an exponentially positive impact on the healthcare system-whether it's quality, cost or patient safety.

OK, But Here's What It's Really Like

Working at Surescripts NT&O, your thinking cap will always be on. You'll be challenged to make sure that disparate, cross-functional pieces come together to create a desired result. You might swarm around some work if you think a milestone is about to be missed. You'll work to quickly understand diverse technologies, and establish and maintain relationships with groups who see and talk about things differently.

Job Summary

This is a tremendous opportunity to work on the Surescripts Software Engineering team! We are looking for four interns to join us full-time during the summer of 2021. Each Software Engineering Intern will be given the opportunity to work on an Agile Team with other Interns and be mentored by the Surescripts' Software Engineering team to develop a new application which will help enhance the capabilities of the nation's leading healthcare network.During the 10-week internship, we will form a small autonomous Agile Team which will focus on creating an application and deploying it to production. The application with be designed, built and tested entirely by the Agile Team. This is a great opportunity to experience full-stack software development, in a mature, agile and fun software engineering environment. Learn how real teams produce reliable, high-quality software.Learn modern frameworks and patterns for web applications and web services. Test and improve the performance, reliability or supportability of your own code. Make an impact in Healthcare Information Technology and contribute to the Surescripts purpose of serving the nation with the single most trusted and capable health information network, built to increase patient safety, lower costs and ensure quality care.

Responsibilities

  • Develop a brand new application to help enhance the capabilities of the nation's leading healthcare network

  • Full stack development of a web application and supporting backend services

  • Work on every aspect of the software development lifecycle including analysis, design, development, testing, and launch

  • Present accomplishments to senior leadership

QualificationsBasic Requirements:

  • Must be able to participate entire timeframe of internship (June 1st - August 6th, 2021)

  • Must be able to work 40 hours per week

  • Working towards a bachelor's degree in computer science or similar discipline (preferable with an expected graduation date of December 2021 or June 2022)

  • Proficient understanding of at least one of the following: Java, C#, C++, C, GoLang, Ruby, Python, JavaScript, Scala, Clojure or similar

Preferred Qualifications:

Rapid7 is a leading provider of security data and analytics solutions that enable organizations to implement an active, analytics-driven approach to cyber security. Rapid7 is trusted by more than 9000 organizations across the globe, including 48% of the Fortune 100. To learn more about Rapid7 or get involved in our threat research, visit www.rapid7.com.

About Us:  

Finix builds payments tools for vertical SaaS and fintech companies. With Finix, businesses can create a custom payments experience for their customers without developing an in-house system or relying on third-party payments providers.

We are a fast-growing fintech startup recently named to both the Forbes Fintech 50 and CB Insights Fintech 250. We closed our Series B funding in February 2020 and announced an extension in August of 2020, bringing our total funding to $96 million. 

While we work hard each day to solve complex payments challenges, our primary focus is our team. A shared personality trait of every Finix team member is a desire to be challenged. As we continue to grow and scale, we are actively looking for passionate payments people of all kinds to join our team. 

We have offices in Cincinnati and San Francisco.

Our Backend Engineering Team is responsible for delivering high-grade fintech software for payments processing, merchant payouts, fees, and custom billing.

As a software engineering intern, you will be working as part of our Financial Systems Team to develop a text/email reminder service that will be used by our customers. Throughout the internship, you will be working on system design, data modeling, algorithms, UI design, and testing for the service.

Finix is looking for someone who has a passion for solving complex problems, thrives in a face paced work environment, and is eager to learn and evolve.
You Will:
    • Develop software that will meaningfully impact Finix and its customers
    • Give and receive technical feedback through code reviews or design discussions
    • Collaborate cross functionally to proactively seek and incorporate feedback
    • Learn quickly by asking great questions, finding how to work with your mentor and teammates effectively, and communicate the status of your work clearly
You Are:
    • Passionate about solving complex computer science and business problems
    • Someone who thrives in a fast paced work environment
    • Someone who is eager to learn and evolve
You Have:
    • A strong fundamental understanding of Computer Science through pursuit of a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Computer Science, math, or a related discipline
    • Some programming experience and familiarity, either through side projects or classwork. We work mostly in Java. We believe new programming languages can be learned if you have computer science fundamentals.
    • Experience from previous internships or other multi-person projects, including open source contributions, that demonstrate evaluating and receiving feedback from mentors, peers, and stakeholders
    • The ability to learn unfamiliar systems and form an understanding of those systems, through independent research and working with a mentor and subject matter experts
    • Strong written and communication skills, being able to effectively convey ideas and teach other team members about your work
What We Offer:

Applicable to full time employees only

Finix offers a comprehensive benefits package. Benefits are effective on the 1st of the month after your start date. 

Health - We offer a variety of health insurance plans with two major carriers (UHC for national coverage and Kaiser as an additional option for CA). Finix pays 90% of the employee premium and 50% of the dependent premium for whichever plan you choose. The remainder of the premium will be deducted from your paycheck pre-tax. 

Dental - PPO dental plan through Beam Dental, one of the best new dental carriers with national coverage. Finix covers 90% of the employee premium and 50% of the dependent premium. 

Vision - Vision plan through VSP. Finix covers 90% of the employee premium and 50% of the dependent premium.  

Life / AD&D - Company-paid Life/AD&D insurance with coverage for 1x your annual salary. 

Short-term / Long-term Disability - Company-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance.

Commuter Benefits Pre-tax account for parking or transit expenses. 

401k - 401k account through Guideline.

Paid Time Off - In addition to federal holidays, we offer accrued time off of up to 15 days per calendar year with a 40-hour carry-over. Sick time is accrued separately at up to 9 days per calendar year.
